intro: Dissochaeta griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
